p: At the time of arrival at Mulago hospital, the patient had been ill for 2 weeks. She presented in a coma (Modified Glasgow Coma Scale 6/15) with prolonged, generalized convulsions that did not respond to 2 doses of first-line anticonvulsants. She had a temperature of 39.2Â°C, a blood pressure reading of 137/93 mmHg, a heart rate of 198 beats/minute and a respiratory rate of 40 breaths/minute. She displayed decorticate posturing, had absent corneal reflexes, and had papilledema on funduscopy.
